title:
On the polynomial equation
  $P(Q(x_1,\ldots,x_m))=Q(P(x_1),\ldots,P(x_m))$
abstract:
We consider the equation $P(Q(x_1,\ldots,x_\nu))=Q(P(x_1),\ldots,P(x_\nu))$
in polynomials over the field of complex numbers and prove that if ${\rm
deg}(P)>1$, then it is only solvable in polynomials that are affinely conjugate
to monomials.
